alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Broadwater, northwestern Madison, central Beaverhead, southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Gallatin Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Silver Star to 11 miles southeast of Divide to 18 miles north of Dillon to 21 miles east of Jackson to 18 miles northeast of Lemhi. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and brief heavy snow and/or graupel. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dillon, Sheridan, Twin Bridges, Pony, Silver Star, Harrison, Melrose, Bannack, Waterloo, Glen, Beaverhead Rock State Park, Lewis And Clark Caverns State Park, Willow Creek and Bannack State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
